Class AddressBook

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • AddressBook
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

     class AddressBook
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    Allows the user to view, modify, and add records in an address book.
    Version:
    1.0 March 4, 2014
    Author:
    Joshua Yuan

    • Field Detail

      • saved

        boolean saved
        boolean: Stores true if the address book that is currently being displayed has been saved. Otherwise, it stores false.

      • MAX_RECORD

        static final int MAX_RECORD
        static final int: Stores the maximum number of records allowed in one address book: 50.
        See Also:

        static int: Stores the record number currently being displayed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AddressBook

        public AddressBook()

    • Method Detail

      • labelsAndFields

        public void labelsAndFields()
        Displays the four text fields, their corresponding labels, and the two labels below the text fields. The first block of code (59 to 86) adds the four labels that are located beside the text fields. The second block of code (89 to 116) adds the four text fields, and the two labels below those text fields.
        Parameters:
        TEXT_FONT - final Font reference: Contains the font used for the field labels.
        firstNameLabel - JLabel reference: Contains the label "Enter first name:" located left of the first text field.
        lastNameLabel - JLabel reference: Contains the label "Enter last name:" located left of the second text field.
        phoneLabel - JLabel reference: Contains the label "Enter phone number:" located left of the third text field.
        emailLabel - JLabel reference: Contains the label "Enter e-mail address:" located left of the fourth text field.

      • buttons

        public void buttons()
        Displays the four buttons on the panel, and adds an action listener to each button.
        Parameters:
        previous - JButton reference: Contains the button "Previous Record". When pressed, the previous record is displayed.
        next - JButton reference: Contains the button "Next Record". When pressed, the next record is displayed.
        update - JButton reference: Contains the button "Save or Update Recod". When pressed, it updates a record or saves a new record.
        addRecord - JButton reference: Contains the button "Add Record". When pressed, it allows the user to create a new record in the address book.

      • setTextFields

        public void setTextFields(boolean clearFields)
        Sets the text fields to display the info of the person that is passed into the method through parameter passing. This method has public access for use in DatabaseApp. The if structure checks if person is null or if the fields should be cleared. If so, it clears the text fields.
        Parameters:
        clearFields - boolean: True if the text fields should be cleared.

      • eraseAndFocus

        private void eraseAndFocus(javax.swing.JTextField field)
        Erases the text in the field specified by 'field', and moves the cursor to the specified text field.
        Parameters:
        field - JTextField reference: Contains the JTextField to be erased and focused.

      • saveOrUpdateRecord

        public void saveOrUpdateRecord()
        Saves the new record or updates the existing record. The if structure checks for invalid input in the following order: no information entered, invalid phone number, and invalid email. The inner if structure determines whether to save a new PersonRecord, or update the current record if it has already been created.

      • traverseAddressBook

        public void traverseAddressBook(boolean isNext)
        Displays the next or previous record in the address book. The if structure checks if the user wishes to view the next or previous record. The first ternary operator redirects the user to the first record if they click "Next Record" when they are on the last record. The second ternary operator redirects the user to the last record if they click "Previous Record" when they are on the first record. The nested ternary operator prevents a run-time error by preventing currentRecord from having a value of -1.
        Parameters:
        isNext - boolean: True if the user wishes to view the next record. False if the user wishes to view the previous record.

      • addRecord

        public void addRecord()
        Displays a blank record to the user. The if structure ensures that the user has not exceeded the maximum number of records.

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
        Determines the method to be invoked when a button is pressed. The if structure determines which button the user pressed.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        ae - ActionEvent reference: Stores information about the action event, which is used to determine which action to perform.
